result.execSummary:
The defendant Jericka N Bernal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Court orders correction to sentence.  At the request of the State, Court orders that restitution in the amount of $130.06 awarded to CRIME VICTIM COMPENSATION FUND.

- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and restitution.   
- As to all costs, surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
with credit for 6 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
*No contact with victim Bryon W.
*No contact with victim's wife, Juana W.
*No contact with establishment where incident occurred.
*No new offenses.

*Absolute sobriety.
*Alcohol assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
*No weapons.
*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jericka N Bernal

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to (262) 878-6016, and mailed to:  TCI Records Staff, 751 County Road K, Fond du Lac, WI  54936-1947

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP, signed and filed.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  
This was mailed directly to Judge Rosa.

Defendant Jericka N Bernal in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing today.  Due to the Court's congested calendar, Court is unable to conduct sentencing hearing.  Court orders hearing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.
/Restitution Worksheet, filed with attachments.

Defendant Jericka N Bernal in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Jacob Daniel Corr for Antonella Aleman   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer DISMISSED.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum, and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.
